title.narrative: SUPPORTING SOCIAL WELFARE SYSTEM REFORM

description.narrative: By the end of 2015, the social welfare system applies a case management approach to its child clients (with a focus on children victims of violence) and ensures the availability of specialized community-based services, with particular emphasis on children with disabilities and adolescents off-track., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2015, more excluded children and families benefit from education, social welfare, and justice services, in line with new legislation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2015, the social welfare system applies a case management approach to its child clients (with a focus on childrenvictims of violence) and ensures the availability of specialized community-based services, with particular emphasis on childrenwith disabilities and adolescents off-track.
% of municipalities financing community-based services for children with disabilities
Proportion of individual care plans for children regularly revised in line with new standards

target.value: 2015:60% of individual care plans for children in formal care revised in time

title.narrative: Availability and implementation of standards and procedures for diversion schemes and other local services for adolescents-at-risk, especially boys

target.value: 2015:Standards and procedures for at least 3 diversion schemes adopted and schemes funded through national budgetary resources. Standards for at least 2 new local services for adolescents-at-risk adopted a

actual.value: 2015:Standards and procedures for 8 diversion schemes developed. Funding remains unresolved. One intervention programme developed. Other

title.narrative: Availability and implementation of standards and licensing procedures for social welfare services and professionals as defined in the Social Welfare Law

baseline.value: No standards or procedures in place

target.value: 2015:Standards for 5 groups of services adopted. All case managers in Centers for Social Work licensed. All state service providers and 70% of other service providers who apply for licensing are licensed

actual.value: 2015:Standards for four groups of services adopted, standards related intensive family support developed. All Case managers in CSWs licensed. 97 NGO service providers licensed (85% of those who applied). As per state service providers (mainly residential care) 0nly 2 out of 81 service providers licensed.
